commented_code:
<_NativeAotSupportedArch Condition="'$(TargetArchitecture)' == 'x64' or '$(TargetArchitecture)' == 'arm64' or '$(TargetArchitecture)' == 'arm' or '$(TargetArchitecture)' == 'loongarch64' or '$(TargetArchitecture)' == 'riscv64' or ('$(TargetOS)' == 'windows' and '$(TargetArchitecture)' == 'x86')">true</_NativeAotSupportedArch>
    <NativeAotSupported Condition="'$(_NativeAotSupportedOS)' == 'true' and '$(_NativeAotSupportedArch)' == 'true'">true</NativeAotSupported>

    <_Crossgen2Supported Condition="'$(TargetOS)' != 'illumos' and '$(TargetOS)' != 'solaris'">true</_Crossgen2Supported>

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -51,6 +51,8 @@
     <_NativeAotSupportedArch Condition="'$(TargetArchitecture)' == 'x64' or '$(TargetArchitecture)' == 'arm64' or '$(TargetArchitecture)' == 'arm' or '$(TargetArchitecture)' == 'loongarch64' or '$(TargetArchitecture)' == 'riscv64' or ('$(TargetOS)' == 'windows' and '$(TargetArchitecture)' == 'x86')">true</_NativeAotSupportedArch>
     <NativeAotSupported Condition="'$(_NativeAotSupportedOS)' == 'true' and '$(_NativeAotSupportedArch)' == 'true'">true</NativeAotSupported>
 
+    <_Crossgen2Supported Condition="'$(TargetOS)' != 'illumos' and '$(TargetOS)' != 'solaris'">true</_Crossgen2Supported>
discussion_comments.comment_body:
```suggestion
    <!-- TODO: Remove this workaround once https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/116929 is fixed -->
    <_Crossgen2Supported Condition="'$(TargetOS)' != 'illumos' and '$(TargetOS)' != 'solaris'">true</_Crossgen2Supported>
```
We should update this to only be true for Debug, Checked or Android builds.
Only enable for Debug, Checked or Android build.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -732,6 +722,28 @@ RETAIL_CONFIG_DWORD_INFO(EXTERNAL_EnableRiscV64Zba,             W("EnableRiscV64
 RETAIL_CONFIG_DWORD_INFO(EXTERNAL_EnableRiscV64Zbb,             W("EnableRiscV64Zbb"),          1, "Allows RiscV64 Zbb hardware intrinsics to be disabled")
 #endif
 
+//
+// These are "legacy" ISA enablement knobs that aren't recommended for use anymore
discussion_comments.comment_body: Are any of these documented in official docs? If they are not, I do not think we need to keep them.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -732,6 +722,28 @@ RETAIL_CONFIG_DWORD_INFO(EXTERNAL_EnableRiscV64Zba,             W("EnableRiscV64
 RETAIL_CONFIG_DWORD_INFO(EXTERNAL_EnableRiscV64Zbb,             W("EnableRiscV64Zbb"),          1, "Allows RiscV64 Zbb hardware intrinsics to be disabled")
 #endif
 
+//
+// These are "legacy" ISA enablement knobs that aren't recommended for use anymore
discussion_comments.comment_body:
They've been discussed in various blogs and are fairly well known in the space as the way to test fallback paths if your hardware supports the latest.

I don't think it'd be the end of the world to drop them and the devs primarily using these switches could update, but didn't want to do so without discussion.

Would the `--instruction-set` flags for R2R/NAOT be in the same boat? If we could remove the extras there it would also simplify things. I don't believe the flag is considered officially supported today, but does print out on the command line.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -732,6 +722,28 @@ RETAIL_CONFIG_DWORD_INFO(EXTERNAL_EnableRiscV64Zba,             W("EnableRiscV64
 RETAIL_CONFIG_DWORD_INFO(EXTERNAL_EnableRiscV64Zbb,             W("EnableRiscV64Zbb"),          1, "Allows RiscV64 Zbb hardware intrinsics to be disabled")
 #endif
 
+//
+// These are "legacy" ISA enablement knobs that aren't recommended for use anymore
discussion_comments.comment_body: `IlcInstructionSet` is explicitly documented in the repo docs as [subject to change without a breaking change notice](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/src/coreclr/nativeaot/docs/optimizing.md).

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -732,6 +722,28 @@ RETAIL_CONFIG_DWORD_INFO(EXTERNAL_EnableRiscV64Zba,             W("EnableRiscV64
 RETAIL_CONFIG_DWORD_INFO(EXTERNAL_EnableRiscV64Zbb,             W("EnableRiscV64Zbb"),          1, "Allows RiscV64 Zbb hardware intrinsics to be disabled")
 #endif
 
+//
+// These are "legacy" ISA enablement knobs that aren't recommended for use anymore
discussion_comments.comment_body: Command line arguments for direct invocation of crossgen2/ilc are not officially documented/supported.

      <EmscriptenEnvVars Include="WASM_PERFTRACING=1" Condition="'$(WasmEnableEventPipe)' == 'true'" />

commented_code:
<_WasmDebuggerSupport Condition="'$(WasmDebugLevel)' != '' and '$(WasmDebugLevel)' == '0'">false</_WasmDebuggerSupport>
    <_WasmDebuggerSupport Condition="'$(_WasmDebuggerSupport)' == '' and '$(WasmBuildingForNestedPublish)' == 'true'">false</_WasmDebuggerSupport> <!-- publish -->
    <_WasmDebuggerSupport Condition="'$(_WasmDebuggerSupport)' == ''">true</_WasmDebuggerSupport>
    <WasmPerfInstrumentation Condition="'$(WasmPerfInstrumentation)' == 'true'">all</WasmPerfInstrumentation>
    <_WasmProfilers Condition="'$(WasmPerfInstrumentation)' != ''">browser:eventpipe,callspec=$(WasmPerfInstrumentation)</_WasmProfilers>
    <WasmPerformanceInstrumentation Condition="'$(WasmPerformanceInstrumentation)' == 'true'">all</WasmPerformanceInstrumentation>

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -256,15 +256,15 @@
     <_WasmDebuggerSupport Condition="'$(WasmDebugLevel)' != '' and '$(WasmDebugLevel)' == '0'">false</_WasmDebuggerSupport>
     <_WasmDebuggerSupport Condition="'$(_WasmDebuggerSupport)' == '' and '$(WasmBuildingForNestedPublish)' == 'true'">false</_WasmDebuggerSupport> <!-- publish -->
     <_WasmDebuggerSupport Condition="'$(_WasmDebuggerSupport)' == ''">true</_WasmDebuggerSupport>
-    <WasmPerfInstrumentation Condition="'$(WasmPerfInstrumentation)' == 'true'">all</WasmPerfInstrumentation>
-    <_WasmProfilers Condition="'$(WasmPerfInstrumentation)' != ''">browser:eventpipe,callspec=$(WasmPerfInstrumentation)</_WasmProfilers>
+    <WasmPerformanceInstrumentation Condition="'$(WasmPerformanceInstrumentation)' == 'true'">all</WasmPerformanceInstrumentation>
discussion_comments.comment_body: it's a bit weird that this property can be `true`, `false`, `all`, `none` etc. I'd stick with one or the other, in this case with the callspec format
